item.description:
The Boston West Photographic Society

Presents a Special Event

Creative Macro & Impressionistic Photography with Charles Needle

Wednesday, October 16, 2010 7:30 p.m. at the Marist House, 518 Pleasant St, Framingham, MA

Admission: BWPS Members free, non member $10 at the door




Don’t miss this special event!

The Program

Discover the unlimited possibilities of creative close-up and impressionistic photography in this special presentation. Speaking to standing-room-only crowds at NECCC in 2010 and 2009, Charles Needle presents his award-winning creative macro and impressionistic photography – and the techniques behind the images – in a special event for BWPS members and guests.

In addition to showing his images and discussing the specific techniques used to create them, Charles’s presentation covers macro basics (equipment, exposure, depth-of-field, composition and lighting), how to use props to enhance your macro photography, soft-glow and composite montage techniques, and multiple-exposure close-ups. He also demonstrates how to create impressionistic, painterly images in-camera using camera movement, multiple-exposure montages, Lensbaby, long exposures and shooting reflections.


The Artist

Charles Needle is an award-winning, Seattle-based fine-art nature photographer, author and workshop leader blessed with a unique eye for design and artistic interpretation. For more than a decade, his popular two-day and intensive five-day “Art of Nature” creative macro workshops and “Garden and Flower Photography” workshops have attracted students worldwide. He also designs and markets tools specifically for creative macro photography.

A FujiFilm USA Talent Team member and North American Nature Photography Association (NANPA) Showcase Award winner (four years in a row), Charles teaches more than a dozen location workshops annually, including international destinations such as Giverny, France where, through special arrangement, his workshops enjoy private access to Monet’s Garden – the very birthplace of impressionism. He also leads destination workshops to Keukenhof Gardens in the Netherlands, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Glacier National Park, Georgia’s Callaway Gardens, and other destinations.

Charles is the author of the eBook Creative Macro Photography: Professional Tips & Techniques. Published in July 2010, it is already receiving rave reviews as one of the most comprehensive, unique books on macro photography ever published.

Charles’s photographs have been published in Nature’s Best and Outdoor Photographer magazines, the 2010 Inner Reflections engagement calendar, and are in private, corporate, and public collections worldwide.

Charles Needle’s website, including his upcoming macro, impressionistic and destination workshops is located www.charlesneedlephoto.com. Information about his book Creative Macro Photography: Professional Tips & Techniques, is at www.charlesneedlephoto.com/creative-macro-photography.html.




More information and a sample of Charles Needle's work can be found on the Boston West Photographic Society website at http://www.bwps.org...

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: Creative Macro & Impressionistic Photography with Charles Needle
